result.execSummary:
The defendant Darvis L Bradford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation except for conditions time.

miscConds.notes: Pay Restitution in the amount of $580.39 to Turquioa during the term of probation.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court sets Restitution at $0 as to Perry S.

Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Work towards obtaining GED/HSD.
Some level of employment that does not interfere with SSI benefits.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms.
Continue/complete any mental health treatment prescribed by doctors.
No Contact Order with Turquioa J. and/or Perry S.

Take all prescribed medication.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).

timeConds.notes: with release for mental health treatment.  3 months of the condition time is STAYED for use by probation agent.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court, in custody. CMC. Probation Agent is in court. Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 90 days (starting 4/28/2018) of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled with Agent and State. State to produce defendant. Hearing scheduled on 6/13/2018 at 1:30 pm.
Court ordered a Hearing with the Probation Agent and the defendant due to condition time request. Agent and State notified to schedule date.
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 10, Judge Havas, for review.  jm

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE and ACKNOWLEDGEMENT.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Request for expungement is denied.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with Attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Kimberly B., defense counsel and defendant. 

- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $580.39 as to Turquioa J.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 as to Perry S.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 54 months with  21 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  24  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  30  months.  

Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
- Serve 9 months in the House of Correction with release for mental health treatment.  3 months of the condition time is STAYED for use by probation agent.
- Continue/complete any mental health treatment prescribed by doctors
- Take all prescribed medication
- Work towards obtaining GED/HSD
- Some level of employment that does not interfere with SSI benefits
- No Contact Order with Turquioa J.   AND/OR  Perry S.
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $580.39 to Turquioa during the term of probation.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Continue/complete any mental health treatment prescribed by doctors
- Take all prescribed medication
- Work towards obtaining GED/HSD
- Some level of employment that does not interfere with SSI benefits
- No Contact Order with Turquioa J.   AND/OR  Perry S.
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $580.39 to Turquioa during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Darvis L Bradford not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not proceed to sentencing hearing on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with Attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms.  

No PSI ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Darvis L Bradford not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Darvis L Bradford not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.   State needs to get an update on victim's medical status.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Matter adjourned for an Arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to the report of Dr. Adrea McGlynn.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding the fact that the report finds defendant competent.  Court finds defendant competent to proceed and reinstates all previous conditions of bail.   Defense/defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report from Dr. Adrea McGlym received and filed.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Report from Mendota Mental Health Institute received and filed.   Pursuant to correspondence, matter needs to be scheduled for an earlier date than the currently scheduled date of 8/21/2015.   Pursuant to time limits, this matter is to be heard on or before August 6, 2015.  Court not in session on this date.  Court finds cause to extend time limits to August 10, 2015.  Matter scheduled for a Hearing on August 10, 2015.  State notified. Notice of Hearing along with Report mailed to Defense counsel this date.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties in receipt of report dated 5-19-15 authored by Dr. John Pankiewicz.  There being no challenge to said report, the court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  Defendant granted 32 days of credit.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services.  Case for review hearing Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wiscons Forensic Unit report dated 5-19-15 authored by John Pankiewicz, M.D., received and filed.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, NOTICE OF APPOINTMENT.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Perry S; Krista R; Ellen H; Donte H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
